intro: Commelina pilosula, commonly known as the hairy dayflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Commelinales order and belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, characterized by its erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, with three petals and three sepals, often appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. The hairy dayflower is often found in moist, shaded environments and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
